frameDefinitions: This frame consists of words that indicate the change of an Item's position on a scale (the Attribute) from a starting point (Initial_value) to an end point (Final_value).
A Cognizer holds a particular Opinion, which may be portrayed as being about a particular Topic.
Due to internal forces/properties, an Entity is inclined towards a particular Behavior, which may be to perform an action or to maintain a state.
A Behavior is classified as entrenched for a Protagonist or a Society.
A Believer has faith in a piece of Content or an Element  which fits into a religious belief system made up of many articles of faith.
This frame contains words for individuals, i.e. humans, with respect to their Religion.
frameExamples: Hawke's Bay winery <t>doubled</t> in size last year.
John <t>thinks</t> that it looks better back .
Do Muslims <t>believe</t> in the virgin birth of Jesus?
The bells call the <t><fex name='Person'>faithful</fex></t> to evensong DNI
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Attribute</fen> is a scalar property that the <fen>Item</fen> possesses.
The entity that has a position on the scale.
The distance by which an <fen>Item</fen> changes its position on the scale.
The position on the scale where the <fen>Item</fen> ends up.
The initial position on the scale from which the <fen>Item</fen> moves away.
A portion of the scale, typically identified by its end points, along which the values of the <fen>Attribute</fen> fluctuate.
A description that presents the <fen>Item</fen>'s state before the change in the <fen>Attribute</fen>'s value as an independent predication.
A description that presents the <fen>Item</fen>'s state after  the change in the <fen>Attribute</fen>'s value as an independent predication.
The <fen>Time</fen> is the time-frame in which the change of position occurs.
A location where Attribute is measured
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose <fen>Opinion</fen> is in question.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s way of thinking, which is not necessarily generally accepted, and which is generally dependent on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s point of view.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has the <fen>Opinion</fen>.
TheFrame Element <fen>Entity</fen> identifies the person or thing that has a tendency towards some Behaviour.
The role <fen>Behavior</fen> marks expressions that indicate which state or action the <fen>Entity</fen> tends towards.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the entrenched <fen>Behavior</fen>.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate whose entrenched <fen>Behavior</fen> is at issue.
This role marks expressions that indicate a region where the <fen>Behavior</fen> is  entrenched.
The <fen>Believer</fen> is the person whose religious beliefs are in question.
The <fen>Content</fen> is the object of the <fen>Believer</fen>'s religious conviction. <fen>Content</fen> can be expressed as a finite clause or in a in-PP Complement.
<fen>Role</fen> is a  function that an Element of the faith is believed to serve.
A predefined, fixed idea to which reference is made throughout the belief system.
The <fen>Person</fen> is the human being.
The religious belief system that the <fen>Person</fen> follows.
listRoleExamples: I fear <fex>this service</fex> will diminish in quality.
Diesels have increased <fex>from having a 20% market share in 1995</fex> to just over 30% in 2004.

It was never bad (1 or 2 seizures a year), but this past decade, it has increased
<fex>to having them 1 day a month</fex> and on that 1 day I have 6 or 7 seizures.
<fex>My</fex> take is that Johnson will not actually make it to the last round .

My take is <fex>that it is a version of the Macbeth story - what happens when people
become violent but cannot quite handle it</fex>.
<fex>Lubomir</fex> was not inclined to believe me
Martha has a tendency <fex>to overdo the housekeeping</fex>.
<fex>His</fex> custom was to come here for the 10 o'clock service.

We can help , you to meet Egyptian people and learn about 
<fex>Egyptian</fex> customs.
They found that a loca custom <fex>in the country</fex> was to walk around barefoot at all times of the year and in all weathers .
A Christian believes <fex>that Jesus of Nazareth was a prophet</fex>.
If a person believes in Jesus <fex>as his Saviour</fex>, he can he baptized.
